Key Match Events: Michael Siani hit a tiebreaking two-run single in the 12th inning
Ryan Helsley pitched two innings for the win, striking out four
Willy Adames hit a two-out RBI double in the 11th for Milwaukee
Steven Matz pitched 4 2/3 innings for the Cardinals
Paul Goldschmidt homered for St. Louis, who won for the third time in four games
Post-Match Reflections: Paul Goldschmidt, who finished with three hits and three RBI, has a 10-game hitting streak
St. Louis manager Oliver Marmol praised the team's mentality and effort
Aaron Civale struck out seven while pitching five innings of three-run ball
Adames went 1 for 5 with three strikeouts, ending his streak of five straight games with a home run
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cardinals won for the third time in four games to move back over.500 at 70-69
Brewers (81-58) had won six of seven
MILWAUKEE -- — Michael Siani hit a tiebreaking two-run single in the 12th inning
The replay official ‘definitively determined’ that Siani ‘failed to maintain firm and secure possession of the ball throughout the catch’
